description_txt: stated on June 25, 2015 in a speech about the Affordable Care Act.:
quote_txt: "By one leading measure, what business owners pay out in wages and salaries is now finally growing faster than what they spend on health insurance" for the first time in 17 years.

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2015 in comments on Fox News:
quote_txt: "The United States doesn’t have the highest murder rate among developed countries. You look at Russia, you look at Brazil, those are countries that have 3 to 5 times higher murder rates than what we have here in the United States."

description_txt: stated on June 12, 2015 in a news release.:
quote_txt: "Income disparities in the United States are the worst since the 1920s."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2015 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: "We are the only major country on Earth that doesn't guarantee health care to all people as a right."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2015 in a broadcast of "The Five" on Fox News:
quote_txt: Polls indicate that "white people think that black people are less intelligent. They think they’re less trustworthy, less patriotic."

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in a statement:
quote_txt: Says "Hillary Clinton's rejection of efforts to make it easier to vote and harder to cheat not only defies logic, but the will of the majority of Americans."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2015 in comments on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: Public support for abortion "is actually going down a little bit," polls show.

description_txt: stated on June 12, 2015 in a press release:
quote_txt: A Texas law "will repatriate $1 billion of gold bullion from the Federal Reserve in New York to Texas."

description_txt: stated on June 25, 2015 in posts on the Internet:
quote_txt: "Lincoln was fervently making plans to send all freed slaves to the jungles of Central America once the (Civil War) was over. … The only thing that kept this from happening was his assassination."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2015 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Wisconsin "was literally broke" when Republicans took office in January 2011.

description_txt: stated on June 4, 2015 in a speech in Houston:
quote_txt: "If you want to vote in" Texas, "you can use a concealed-weapon permit as a valid form of identification, but a valid student ID isn’t good enough."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2015 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: Says Jeb Bush "appointed a guardian for the fetus of a rape survivor."

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2015 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: Says Jeb Bush "said low-income women should ‘get their life together and find a husband.' "

description_txt: stated on June 23, 2015 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "The Civil War wasn't about slavery."

description_txt: stated on June 23, 2015 in a speech in Florissant, Mo.:
quote_txt: American schools are "more segregated than they were in the 1960s."

description_txt: stated on June 21, 2015 in comments on Face the Nation:
quote_txt: "We have at least 200,000 to 300,000 hate crimes in a given year."

description_txt: stated on June 12, 2015 in comments on the Hugh Hewitt radio show:
quote_txt: ISIS reaches "about 100 million people a day" through social media.

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2015 in a chain email:
quote_txt: "Under the Affordable Care Act, anyone on Medicare who is admitted to a hospital for observation will be responsible for the bill. Medicare won't pay a cent."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2015 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says Barack Obama told the U.S. Coast Guard Academy "that the number one threat to the military and the world today is global warming."

description_txt: stated on June 8, 2015 in an ad:
quote_txt: As governor, Maggie Hassan first proposed a $1 billion spending increase.

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2015 in comments on Fox Business Network:
quote_txt: Says South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley "is an immigrant."

description_txt: stated on June 7, 2015 in an interview on CBS' Face the Nation:
quote_txt: On Common Core.

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2015 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Scott Walker "said that forcing women facing abortion to get invasive ultrasounds was 'just a cool thing.'"

description_txt: stated on June 21, 2015 in a Miami Herald op-ed:
quote_txt: "After (Jeb) Bush’s two terms in office, Florida’s graduation rate was dead last and remains near the bottom."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2015 in a news report:
quote_txt: Between 1980 and 2010, water usage in Georgia dropped even as the state’s population grew.

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2015 in a speech launching his 2016 campaign:
quote_txt: "The party in the White House" is responsible for "a massive tax increase on the middle class."

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2015 in comments on CNN's State of the Union:
quote_txt: Says Hillary Clinton "was completely exonerated, when I was in the White House" by an official inquiry on Whitewater.

description_txt: stated on June 14, 2015 in comments on CNN's State of the Union:
quote_txt: After a federal inquiry corroborated Hillary Clinton on Whitewater, "the next day, there was nothing in the media about it."

description_txt: stated on June 16, 2015 in comments on "The Daily Show":
quote_txt: "46 percent of women between the age of 16 to 24 despise sexual contact" in Japan.

description_txt: stated on May 30, 2015 in a speech in New Hampshire:
quote_txt: "Nationally, the unemployment rate for veterans is far greater than the national unemployment rate," and Wisconsin is "one of those rare examples where unemployment is actually lower for veterans than it is for the population as a whole and certainly lower than it is nationally."
